question: The total inductance of a series inductor circuit is:

options.A: equal to the sum of the individual inductance values
options.B: equal    to    the    sum    of    the individual   inductive-reactance values
options.C: less than the value of the smallest inductor
options.D: equal to the source voltage divided by total current

question: Doubling the number of turns of wire in an inductor:

options.A: reduces the value of inductance by one-half
options.B: multiplies the value of inductance by two
options.C: multiplies the value of inductance by four
options.D: reduces the value of inductance by one-fourth

question: Which one of the following statements best describes magnetic hysteresis?

options.A: Hysteresis is the amount of magnetic flux that is not confined to the core material of an electromagnet
options.B: Hysteresis is most apparent when a steady amount of current is lowing through the coil of an electromagnet
options.C: Hysteresis is most apparent when the current through the coil of an electromagnet changes frequently
options.D: Hysteresis is most apparent when the core material is saturated

options.A: The voltage remains at one polarity and at a steady level
options.B: The voltage remains at one polarity but changes value periodically
options.C: The voltage causes current to flow in two directions at the same time

question: Current and voltage are said to be in phase when:

options.A: their waveforms are both ac or both dc
options.B: they have the same amplitude and frequency
options.C: their waveforms cross through zero and reach positive and negative peaks at the same time

Which one of the following is a statement of Kirchhoffs current law?

options.A: The current through a resistance is proportional to the value of resistance and the IR drop across it
options.B: The total current in a parallel circuit is less than the value of the smallest current
options.C: The algebraic sum of currents in a loop is equal to zero
options.D: The algebraic sum of currents entering and leaving a point is equal to zero

question: Which one of the following statements is true for the impedance of a series RC circuit?

options.A: The impedance is greater than the sum of the resistance and capacitive reactance
options.B: The impedance is equal to the sum of the resistance and capacitive reactance
options.C: The impedance is greater than either the resistance or capacitive reactance but less than their sum
options.D: The impedance is less than the sum of the resistance and capacitive reactance
